ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead
ygData.msgSnippet: Uhh... hags and werebats are not undead.  As to the monks someone else has a theory that undead in unrest aren t flagged the same as normal undead are. I tend
ygData.messageBody:
Uhh... hags and werebats are not undead. As to the monks someone else has a
theory that undead in unrest aren't flagged the same as normal undead are.
I tend to believe this theory and I'll test it with my ranger and camo next
time I'm on EQ.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Lonnie Lewis" <llewis@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 11:07 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead


> From: Lonnie Lewis <llewis@...>
>
> Actually, that's not true. Hags were white to me, and /conned
indifferent,
> and didn't attack. Same with werebats, skeletal monks, etc. It's just
that
> some (barbed bones, a skeleton) see through, no matter the difference. I
> still don't know why level 5 a skeletons attack me anymore.
>
> Bien
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin L. Crawford [SMTP:Lyrnia@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 11:04 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead
> >
> > From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
> >
> > Everyone that I have ever seen purport that Clouding works vs. undead
> > seems to have 1 major misconception:
> >
> > All the undead in unrest except Barbed bones (and higher) are under
level
> > 20, which means they have green coward code affecting them. You could,
at
> > level 30, walk around in unrest pretty much unperturbed by ANY of the
> > undead simply because they won't attack you because you're so far above
> > them in level.
> >
> > Just because an undead critter doesn't attack doesn't mean you're
> > invisible to them. Try using clouding then CONNING the undead. They
> > still con as 'ready to attack'. Which means they can see you. They
just
> > won't agg because you are higher level than them.
> >
> > Lyrnia the amused.
> >
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> >
